alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 4:54PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northeastern Livingston, northern Tangipahoa and Washington Parishes, southwestern Walthall, southern Pike, southeastern Amite and southwestern Pearl River Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 454 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bogalusa to 6 miles north of Roseland. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Franklinton, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Kentwood, Independence, Varnado, Roseland, Folsom, Sun, Osyka, Montpelier, Enon, Crossroads, Mount Herman, Wilmer, Bush, Gillsburg and Easleyville. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 38 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
